title: Susan B. Anthony Papers: Daybook and Diaries, 1856-1906; Diaries; 1890

Drs Tracy & Halverson
Mitchell, G. P.,
Bob Stanton
39 - West 36th st
New York
C.A.F. Stebbins
719 Fourth Avenue
Detroit - Mich

182 Elm St - Holyoke - Mass
entries.fullText:
Mrs Anna Whiting
182 Elm St - Holyoke - Mass
entries.summaryText: Mrs Anna Whiting is located at 182 Elm St in Holyoke, Massachusetts.

entries.fullText:
Calendar for 1890.
Wed Jan 1 - Tue Dec. 31
entries.summaryText: Calendar for 1890.

entries.fullText:
There will be three Eclipses this year, two of the Sun and
one of the Moon, and a Lunar Appulse, as follows:
I. A Lunar Appulse, June 3. The nearest approach of the
Moon to the Earth's shadow will occur at 11 h. 53 m. morn.,
Washington mean time. The uncertainty of atmospheric conditions
renders it impossible to say whether the Moon will be
seen to enter the Earth's shadow or not.
II. An Annular Eclipse of the Sun, June 17, invisible in
North America, visible throughout Europe.
III. A Partial Eclipse of the Moon, November 26, visible in
the Southern Pacific Ocean.
entries.summaryText: Information about three eclipses that will occur in 1890.

entries.fullText:

3. Mars, until Feb. 9. Jupiter, from Jan. 10 to May 1.
Saturn, from Aug. 10 to Dec. 8. Uranus, until Jan. 16
and after Oct. 20, and Neptune, from May 25 to Aug. 30.
entries.summaryText: Information about morning stars in 1890.

entries.fullText:
Evening Stars.
Mercury, until Jan. 29, and from April 9 to May 30, July
22 to Sept 29, and after Nov. 16. Venus, from Feb. 18 to
Dec. 3. Mars, after Feb. 9. Jupiter until Jan. 10, and
after May 1. Saturn, until Aug. 30, and after Dec. 8.
Uranus, from Jan. 16 to October 20, and Neptune, until
May 25, and after Aug. 30.
entries.summaryText: Information about evening stars in 1890.

entries.fullText:
Heavy-Face Figures in these Almanac pages indicate time
from 6 P.M. to 6 A.M.
entries.summaryText: Explanation of heavy-face figures in the almanac pages.

entries.fullText: At the Riggs house - Guest of Mr. C.M. And Mrs. June H. Stafford & her sister Sapphronia C. Snow Received in the P.M. in the red parlor with Mrs. Clara B. Colly & Mrs Tara Winstrop Smith through a rainy-sloppy-muggy day Quite a number called. Phoebe M. [Cowgind] & her Her brother John & their mother All at Riggs 20 acres & home been for Once a month- trying to get Some government [dues] & Office in departments Mr & Mrs. [Bement] of Phila, visiting Mr & Mrs Shafford - they dined in private room - all the permanent visitors - [Cougena] & Anthony - Mrs Colly & [?] and Mrs Smith - at the gaming table in Big dining room -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is a guest at the Riggs house in Washington D.C. and spends the day with various visitors, including Phoebe M. Cowgind and her family, and Mr. and Mrs. Bement of Philadelphia.

entries.fullText:
Cloudy - looking like rain.
Mrs. Stafford took Mrs.
Blount and myself to a
women [?]/92 celebration.
all the [?]
entries.summaryText: Attended a women's celebration with Mrs. Stafford and Mrs. Blount in Washington DC.

entries.fullText:
In Washington
at home all day.
entries.summaryText: Stayed at home all day in Washington.

entries.fullText:
Nice [?] suffrage[?] meeting held in Red
Palm this evening - over a
hundred present.
[15?] elected new officers
and 6 delegates to Washington [Con?]
Dr. Susan [Colson?]
President
Made Senate calls
this afternoon [?]
[Wh?] meeting [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a suffrage meeting in Red Palm with over a hundred people present. New officers were elected and six delegates were chosen to go to Washington. Susan B. Anthony made Senate calls and attended another meeting.

entries.fullText:
Hon. William D. Kelly
for nearly 30 years a
member of Congress
died at the Riggs this morning at
6.20 [?{]. his wife and
two sons. William D. Kelly Jr and
Albert and daughter [?]
[?] [?]. Mrs.
Hortsman been with him
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony noted the death of Hon. William D. Kelly, a member of Congress for nearly 30 years, who died at the Riggs hotel that morning. His wife, two sons, and daughter were with him. Mrs. Hortsman had been with him as well.

entries.fullText:
Judge Kelly's
daughter Florence
came this A.M--
-- Funeral services
to be held in the
House of Representatives
on Saturday at 12. noon --
entries.summaryText: Funeral services for Judge Kelly's daughter Florence to be held in the House of Representatives on Saturday.

entries.fullText:
In Washington
Bade Florence
Kelley & her mother
good bye --For neary
30 years Mrs. Kelley's
thoughts have been
centred in Washington
though in person she
has been here but
very little -- having
during nine years giving
birth to 8 children --
only 3 of whom are alive
today -- Florence is a dear
brave bright girl -- is
the mother of 2. children
husband a doctor & a
Russian --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony says goodbye to Florence Kelley and her mother, who have been in Washington for nearly 30 years. Florence is a mother of two, married to a doctor and a Russian.

entries.fullText:
Heard E.E. Hale
both A.M. and evening
-- his thoughts good
but his enunciation
is too horrid to be
endured --
Mr. Spofford took
4. P.M. train for Phila --
with members and Senators
come to attend funeral
of Hon. Wm D. Kelley
at noon -- tomorrow --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony heard E.E. Hale speak in Washington and Mr. Spofford left for Philadelphia to attend a funeral.

entries.fullText:
At the Riggs --
Mrs. Bradwell of
Chicago -- received
with me -- A goodly
number of calls --
-- Mrs. Wallace -- the
Pres. of Women's Fair Com.
of Chicago -- told of their work --
-- Mrs Dorcas Hull -- &
Phoebe Hallock -- sisters of
dear Sarah Hallock called --
Phoebe Couzins, her
mother & brother John --
took 3:30 train for home
St. Louis -- had been
here nearly two months.
-- I have been here
five weeks this A.M.
-- Went to Senate & saw
Mr. Platt present women's
Celebration Petition! it was
Hiscocks Fair Com.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony received visitors in Riggs, including Mrs. Wallace who talked about the Women's Fair Com. of Chicago. Phoebe Couzins and her family left for St. Louis after being in town for two months. Susan B. Anthony went to the Senate and saw Mr. Platt present a women's Celebration Petition.

entries.fullText:
Made calls on wives of M. Co with Mrs. Major Powell [?]
Mrs. Lucia E. Blount -- in her carriage -- Left cards for all in the Riggs -- Mrs. Arnold, Mrs. Spooner, McComas, Smith, Hansborough, [Sene?], Lester, Caruth, McDonald, Mrs & Mrs Scofield, Mrs Hatch & daughter -- found out -- Mrs. Payson, & [?] -- in Mrs Gifford, Nan Schaik, Mrs. Lockwood Conger, out Caswell -- in -- Carey, Cornell, Moore,: Perkins -- Dorsey, Flint, Hager, Matson Burrows, Garnett, out McCreay, Pugsley -- a full two hours of rapid work --
entries.summaryText: Made calls on wives of M. Co with Mrs. Major Powell and Mrs. Lucia E. Blount and left cards for many people.

entries.fullText: Mrs. Stafford drove me round. to call on the wives of his members of the Cabinet -- Vice Pres. Morton - Speaker Reid, Sec'y Windom, Wanamaker, Rusk, Noble, Tracy, Proctor -- Miller Mrs. Blaine not receiving -- and at 8:20 evening -- Word came that their oldest son Walker Blaine had just died of pneumonia!! Got letter from Sister Mary -- saying brother D. R. and she -- she hoped Sister Annie and Maude would be here on Feb 15th --
entries.summaryText: Visited the wives of members of the Cabinet and received news of the death of Walker Blaine, oldest son of Mrs. Blaine.

entries.fullText:
Between 3 & 6 -- P.M. ---
Made senatorial calls -- with
Mrs. [M????] Powell in Mr.
Woffords carriage & Mr. & Mrs. [?]
Miss Mary Blount in their carriage
Squires, Stewart, Ingalls,
Hale, Davis, Nance, Teller
Edmund, Mitchell, Farwell
Stanford, Cockrell -- Baker
Visited with Mrs.
Wofford this evening --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony made senatorial calls with several people at the Riggs House.

entries.fullText:
Bright, crisp day--
almost the first one of this season --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony notes the weather at the Riggs.

entries.fullText: The funeral of Secretary James G. Blaine's son Walker Blaine -- Was at the Church of the Covenant this morning at 11 oclock -- a great crowd lined the streets at church -- A meeting called by Mrs. Talbot -- of the [?] children's society -- at the Riggs Parlor - Prof Harris -- of Bureau of Education talked of compulsory education
entries.summaryText: Funeral of Secretary James G. Blaine's son Walker Blaine and a meeting about compulsory education.

entries.fullText: A Bright day -- just fairly crisp -- but not cold at all like winter
entries.summaryText: A description of the weather.

entries.fullText: Henry the Coachman took me the rounds this A.M. to Milnes, Mrs Colbys, Miss [?], Mrs Uptons, House -- Senate -- and Mr Darby's -- got order on New Senate Folding room Clerk to receive fold & send to me the 5 draft of Senator Palmers speech to send to South Dakota
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony goes around Washington with Henry the Coachman and gets an order to receive a draft of Senator Palmer's speech to send to South Dakota.

entries.fullText: Mrs. Senator Teller -- of Colorado -- & Miss Teller -- invited me to a tea from 3 to 6 -- this P.M -- Mrs Celia Whipper Wallace-- of Chicago -- & Saratoga - arrived this A.M. from the Springs -- Has the starting of a new paper in Chicago -- on the [?] At breakfast table got letter from Mrs Stanton -- "you'll have me under your thumb this last of this week - & I at once wrote & enclosed a $25 check to her --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a tea with Mrs. Senator Teller and Miss Teller and receives a letter from Mrs. Stanton, to whom she sends a $25 check.

entries.fullText:
Howard university --
Washington D.C-- Rev J. E.
Rankin -- reception -- as
President -- Secretary
Windsor to preside
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a reception at Howard University in Washington D.C. with Rev J. E. Rankin and Secretary Windsor.

entries.fullText:
In Washington
at 1:30 -- Miss [?]
and self went -- to Senate
Gallery -- had a time
getting in even to
attend -- to hear
Senator J.J. Byalls
great speech on
exporting the Negroes
from the southern states
-- It was a fearful
sharing of the brutal
violation of human
and constitutional rights --
--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a speech by Senator J.J. Byalls on exporting African Americans from southern states, describing it as a 'fearful sharing of the brutal violation of human and constitutional rights.'

entries.fullText: The postmaster general and Mrs Wanamakers at home -- from 9 to 10 -- this evening. Didn't go to the reception -- hadn't the courage to go alone --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony didn't attend a reception because she didn't have the courage to go alone. The postmaster general and Mrs. Wanamakers were at home.

entries.fullText: Went to Senate Folding Room to see who [why?] the Palmer speech wasn't sent to the Riggs -- promised to send this P.M. but didn't -- Letter that Mrs. Stanton wouldn't come till Monday -- Mr. & Mrs Spofford went to Phila. to the Golden Wedding of Mr. & Mrs [Be????t]. In evening Miss Brown & self called at Mrs Polly's -- 11th & G Streets
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony went to the Senate Folding Room to inquire about a speech. Mrs. Stanton delayed her arrival until Monday. Mr. & Mrs. Spofford attended a Golden Wedding in Philadelphia. Susan B. Anthony visited Mrs. Polly in the evening.

entries.fullText:
looked over letters
& wrote letters from
10. to 5. without a
stop -- Then Mrs
Colby & Adelaide
Johnson called - &
Miss Irwin & self took dinner --
-- all day I have had
to feel sorry over Mr Colbys
publishing a little funny
recital of one of Mrs De[???s]
meetings in Land Co --
the people there feel angry
over it --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spends the day in Washington, looking over and writing letters. Mrs. Colby, Adelaide Johnson, and Miss Irwin visit and they all have dinner together. Susan feels sorry over Mr. Colby's publishing of a funny recital of one of Mrs. De[???]'s meetings in Land Co, which has caused anger among the people there.

entries.fullText:
Brother D. R, Sister
Annie O and May S. and
Niece Maude arrived
at 4 P.M --
May Hallowell &
Sarah Willis -- &
Lucy Boardman with
Mrs S. P. Smith - [?]
Marsh Parker all
of my own city --
Surely my own
family -- my own city
and my own suffrage
friends do me more
honor than I can
deserve --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony's family and suffrage friends arrived in Washington to visit her.

entries.fullText:
Cousin's Hannah,
Boyles, Melissa Dickinson
Dr. Fannie & Charles
all came from Chicago
and Cousin Lucien
and Ellen Hoxier [?]
from Brooklyn --

On Saturday nephew
Arthur Mosher --
& Niece Louise &
husband & Mrs James --
Miss Morrison -- Eliza
Wright Osborn & Ellen
Wright Garrison -- ,
So many many of my
friends
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony's friends and family from Chicago and Brooklyn arrived in Washington to visit her.

entries.fullText: This closes my allotted three score & ten years - and starts me on the last decade of my fourth score. Many friends came in time for the Banquet gotten up by Mrs Ivy Knight Jewall & dear Rachel Foster Avery - the one sorrow was that the latter couldn't be here -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony celebrates her 70th birthday in Washington D.C. with a banquet organized by Mrs. Ivy Knight Jewall and Rachel Foster Avery.

entries.fullText: The Boston Party arrived this A.M. - and all day the delegates & friends kept arriving - Sunday evening our National's held a meeting to talk of who should be President - neither Mrs Stanton nor Miss Anthony were allowed in -
entries.summaryText: Delegates and friends arrive in Washington D.C. for a meeting to discuss the presidency, but Mrs. Stanton and Miss Anthony were not allowed in.

entries.fullText:
In Washington -
When 10 Oclock came
the Nationals packed
the Private dining room
to suffocation - & the
Americans looked
lost in the great parlor -
- so I proposed to the
A's to exchange with
the N's - which they did
very cheerfully - Mrs
Gage was present - & I made
her understand - in my speech on
Mrs Stanton for Pres - that all of
her mean efforts to persuade
any members that I favored
union - from ambition to
supersede Mrs Stanton - were
fully known to me - & I
appealed to all - as they
would do me personal honor
to vote solid for Mrs Stanton --
at their National American
Union meeting in the
afternoon. - I was filled with most
Righteous indignation at her -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is in Washington and proposes to exchange the dining room with the Nationals and Americans. She makes a speech about Mrs. Stanton for President and calls out Mrs. Gage's mean efforts to persuade members.

entries.fullText:
The National American Association
met publicly for the first
time - in the 22nd annual
Washington Woman Suffrage
Convention this A.M. - and
Mrs Stanton as its
President made the
opening speech - her
daughter Harriet came
to the stage & said a few
words - in look & manner
she showed herself with
her mother & her mother's
life long friend & co-worker -
- It was a proud moment
for me - & for all of us -
of the old National - and
ought to be to all who truly
love the cause fully -
Wm. Dudly Tenlke followed with
a very fine address - at
4 P.M. Mrs Spofford & self
saw Mrs Stanton & daughters
Maggie & Hattie off for
New York - & we though
sad at the parting were full
of joy that Mrs S. went [?]
with the [?] of the whole suffrage [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends the 22nd annual Washington Woman Suffrage Convention where Mrs. Stanton makes the opening speech. Harriet, Mrs. Stanton's daughter, also speaks. Later, Mrs. Stanton and her daughters leave for New York.

entries.fullText:
-- Though fancy looking
is surely sadly wanting
in good acoustic
properties -
I presided at
the A.M. Public
session - and
at the 3 P.M. Executive
Session - never
again at the evening
Public session -
-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony presided over the A.M. Public session and the 3 P.M. Executive Session at the 22d Annual Washington Convention held at Lincoln Music Hall in Washington D.C.

entries.fullText:
Third day of [the?]
22d Wash. Con-
Every thing seems
moving smoothly-
though no doubt
there is at heart
some chagrin that
Mrs Stanton is the
chosen standard bearer
- & that by a vote of 131
to 90 - I sprang to make
it a unanimous vote - but
was too late - so the first
informal vote - was made
the formal one 131 to 90 -
Mrs Julia Ward
Howe seemed to me
to speak better than er
before - as did H.B.B.
All called on Mrs
Harrison at 4. P.M
today -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the third day of the 22d Washington Convention in Washington D.C. and noted that everything seemed to be moving smoothly. She also mentioned that Mrs Stanton was chosen as the standard bearer and that Mrs Julia Ward Howe and H.B.B. spoke well. All attendees called on Mrs Harrison at 4 P.M. that day.

entries.fullText:
4th day of the 22d Con
We rounded out
with Mrs Mallard-
Olympia Brown &
Rev Amie Shaw
this last eving - &
loved with seeming
good feeling all
round - Mrs. Howe
made [??] - lovely
word to me -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spends time with Mrs Mallard, Olympia Brown, and Rev Amie Shaw. Mrs. Howe says a lovely word to her.

entries.fullText:
In Washington
In the P.M.
received a telegram
from Rachel
saying- I would receive
a letter from her
[*in the A.M.*] which
I must not open-
- and at last thing
at night in came to
me - & I longed to
open it - but said
I'll humor Rachel
but Sunday night
when the telegram
came for me to go to
her I opened it [???]
a wish - & found my
worst-fears of Julia
confirmed-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony receives a telegram from Rachel telling her not to open a letter until Sunday night. When she receives the telegram to go to Rachel, she opens the letter and finds her worst fears about Julia confirmed.

entries.fullText:
In Washington -
Very many of the friends still left here-
Alice Blackwell - Mrs. Minor-
Mrs. Clay Bennett - Mrs
Hooker - Miss Momson
Mr Emil Howland et al
At - 9 P.M. I recd
a telegram from dear
Rachel - bidding me go
to her at Bristol at once
- I took the 11. P.M,
train - a sleeper - remained
in it until 6.20 A.M.
Monday - and thought-
and feared the need
of me - was her condition
of dear Julia's mind -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony receives a telegram from Rachel to go to Bristol and describes her journey there.

entries.fullText:
Left Phila at 6.50 &
reached Bristol at 7.50 -
found Mr. & Mrs P??
just through breakfast
-Rachel & Julia neither
of them up - but soon
R. came down to
ask if aunt Susan
had been heard from
- and there she
told me of dear Julias
sadshell of mind - & of
the visit of doctors
Groff & Montgomery
yesterday - & their orders
to take her to Dr Phillips
& put her under his
sole care-
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony arrives in Bristol and learns about Julia's mental state and the doctors' orders to take her to Dr. Phillips.

entries.fullText:
This A.M at 4.50 -
Mrs Kate Renee & self
accompanied dear
Julia T. Foster from
Bristol to Phila - &
there were met my
Dr Groff - & went to
Clifton - & the next
Station beyond - where we
met by Dr Phillips coach
& taken to his house -
- and there we left
dear Julia - in the
hope that good might
come to her from the
entire change -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony accompanied Julia T. Foster from Bristol to Philadelphia, where they met with Dr. Groff and went to Clifton and the next station beyond. They were met by Dr. Phillips' coach and taken to his house, where they left Julia in the hope that good might come to her from the entire change.

entries.fullText:
In Washington
Miss Maude
tool Miss Ruth Plumb
to the National theatre
this P.M. and
Mrs Spafford took
brother J. N. and sister Annie & May
a drive to the
Soldiers Home -
& Annie enjoyed
it very much -
& she acknowledges
she is feeling very
much better —
Miss Lucy E. took 3. P. M.
train - & Miss Thomson & miss
Howland the noon - for Phila -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony's group went to the National Theatre in Washington, while Mrs. Spafford took J. N., Annie, and May for a drive to the Soldiers Home. Annie enjoyed it very much and acknowledged that she is feeling much better. Miss Lucy E. took the 3 PM train, while Miss Thomson and Miss Howland took the noon train for Philadelphia.

entries.fullText:
Sister Mary & self
went to the B. & U,
depot at 11. A. M. &
saw brother Daniel A,
Sister Annie O. & Miss
Maude start for
Leavenworth - ?id Ann
Ann Asher to visit
Nephew D. R. J.
And at 2 P.M. - ,
I went there to see sister
Mary off - no - Mrs Spafford
& I drove her there to
Depot - no - I believe, I
let her go alone - by this
time it was rainy -
[Niece Annie & Sister]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony and Sister Mary saw off some family members and acquaintances at the B. & U. depot in Washington.

entries.fullText:
and lovely enough
with all gone
- save Mrs
Southworth of
Cleveland -
It has been
a close two weeks
of constant stretch -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony reflects on the past two weeks in Washington, with only Mrs. Southworth of Cleveland remaining.

entries.fullText:
calleda t evng a
few minutes at
Mrs Cally's offic 1015 -
G street - met there mr
Daniel of virginia -
knew him in 187? - at
the Phila. National
republican Convention
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony met with Mr. Daniel of Virginia at Mrs. Cally's office in Washington.

entries.fullText:
In Washington
Went to Unitarian
Church & heard
Rev Rush Shiften -
a nice sermon -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the Unitarian Church in Washington and heard a nice sermon by Rev Rush Shiften.

entries.fullText:
received several
calls - and
missed a half
dozzen in the
evg by going out
with Miss Snow to
armory Hall - to
hear Mrs Clara Foltz of
California - but she wasnt
there -
entries.summaryText: Received several calls and missed a speech by Mrs Clara Foltz of California at armory Hall due to going out with Miss Snow.

entries.fullText:
received a letter
from sister Mary
saying she & Rachel
& little Miriam went
out to Clifton to see
Julia yestery -
& found her sad
as when she went
there - but said
she rather stay there
than to go home or
anywhere else -
entries.summaryText: Received a letter from sister Mary about a visit to Julia in Clifton where she was found to be sad but preferring to stay there than to go home or anywhere else.

entries.fullText:
Trying to get ever
with the work -
it is two weeks
to day since Mrs Stanton & Hattie sailed
from New York
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is in Washington and mentions Mrs Stanton and Hattie sailing from New York two weeks ago.

entries.fullText:
went alone fr
Miss Sheldon & her
sister Mrs Grant - Mrs
Sumner rode with
us to Capitol Hill -
then we took a nice
drive through the
grounds - wrote
plan of campaign
to Mrs Barker - f
South Dakota -
She doesn't seem
to me to grasp the
Situation ! .
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is in Washington and writes a plan of campaign to Mrs Barker from South Dakota, but doesn't think she understands the situation.

entries.fullText:
Sister Mary left
Phila. for home - this
A.M.- Mrs. Spofford's
friend Mrs Richardson
of New York - lunched
with her & rode with
us in afternoon -
called at senate to
see Blair & Nance
but failed -
Received letter from niece
Maude - telling of safe arrival
home of herself - mother & father
& pleasant visit with D.R. Jr
at Ann Arbor-

At breakfast table
Saturday A.M. found letter
from Mrs. Stanton telling
of her's & Hattie's safe arrival
at Portsmouth- England -
entries.summaryText: Sister Mary left, Mrs. Richardson visited, and Maude sent a letter.

entries.fullText:
In Washington
at the Riggs -
Day crisp, clear & lovely
Mrs Spofford & I
called for Ellen H.
Sheldon - & we drove
for an hour or more
- Miss Sheldon reports
better -but is weak
enough - & cough
bad enough - seems
to have the prevail'g
cough - added to hers of
longer standing --
Mrs Spofford - Mr. L & Miss
Snow each have the
fashionable cough - la grippe
and I have coughed,
for a week- most aggravatingly
- Mr John R. McLean & Miss
Mrs Rush Shippen Huidekoper -
called & invited me to Mr McLeans
this evening - at 9 o'clock - Miss
Risley Seward had promised
[bring?] the card - and forgotten to
do it!!
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spends time with Mrs. Spofford and Ellen H. Sheldon, and receives an invitation to Mr. McLean's.

entries.fullText: The Bill for the Admission of Wyoming into the Union was passed today at 4.30 P.M. - by a vote of 134 to 127 after the voting down one after another of three amendments proposed by Springer of Ill. each aiming at the disfranchisment of the woman - before allowing it to come into the union -
entries.summaryText: The Bill for the Admission of Wyoming into the Union was passed, despite three amendments proposed by Springer of Ill. each aiming at the disfranchisment of the woman.

entries.fullText: APRIL, WEDNESDAY 16. 1890.

Nephew Wendell P. Mosher
- Youngest son of my dear sister
Hannah is to be married to miss
Carolyn Mixer of Cleveland
Ohio - on this day. -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony's nephew, Wendell P. Mosher's youngest son, is getting married to Carolyn Mixer of Cleveland, Ohio on April 17th, 1890.

entries.fullText:
Left Huron South Dakota at 2 P.M.
reached Miller - Hand Co -
at 4 - Met Anna Shaw
at a little dingy hotel - she
had a good audience - &
thy organized a Hard Co. [?]
[?] -
Pres. Manford Williams Esqr
vice Pres - Capt G. A. Gray
Sec'y F. M. Burton
Treas. Mrs W.G. White -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony left Huron South Dakota and met Anna Shaw in Miller - Hand Co - where they organized a Hard Co. [?] with the help of Manford Williams Esqr, Capt G. A. Gray, F. M. Burton, and Mrs W.G. White.

entries.fullText: APRIL MONDAY 28 1890

Redfield - S.D.
Mrs Picklin & self came
to this place from Huron
to do our best to fill place
of Rev Anna Shaw - who
was to speak here to night -
- had fine audience
the guests of Mrs
[Inelsy]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony and Mrs Picklin traveled to Redfield, South Dakota from Huron to fill in for Rev Anna Shaw who was unable to speak. They had a fine audience and were guests of Mrs [Inelsy].

entries.fullText:
Dr. Hall--nice Pres--
Guest of Mr. & Mrs. Ficeland
at the Free Methodist Seminary.
--Meetings at 2 P.M. in the
large assembly hall--on 2d
floor--250 present--Dr. Hall
presiding--at 8:20 evening
fully 250 were packed into the
room--the most earnest
men & women--farmers
drove in from every one of the
15 townships--some came 28
miles--two families drove
12 miles--brought food cooked
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a convention in Wessington Springs, Jerauld County E.S. and describes the attendees, including Dr. Hall and Mr. & Mrs. Ficeland, and the location, Free Methodist Seminary. She notes that 250 people were present and that farmers drove in from every one of the 15 townships.

entries.fullText:
Mrs. S. H. Blank
Ed McHerold--W. Springs
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony briefly mentions two people, Mrs. S. H. Blank and Ed McHerold, in Wessington Springs on May 11, 1890.

entries.fullText: Alpena -
entries.summaryText: Journal entry from May 12, 1890, written in Alpena.

entries.fullText:
Sanborn Co. Con. -
Woonsockett --
Hon S . A. Ramsey
manage -- found Mrs
Howell at the Hotel -
entries.summaryText: Journal entry from May 13, 1890, written in Woonsockett. Mentions Hon S. A. Ramsey and Mrs. Howell at the hotel.

entries.fullText:
Sanborn Co. Con
Woonsocket
entries.summaryText: Journal entry on May 14, 1890, written in Woonsocket, mentioning Sanborn Co. Con.

entries.fullText:
Aurora Co Con --
Plankinton
entries.summaryText: Journal entry on May 15, 1890, written in Plankinton, mentioning Aurora Co Con.

entries.fullText: Aurora Co. Con --
entries.summaryText: Journal entry from May 16, 1890, written in Aurora Co. Con --.

entries.fullText:
Brule County
Chamberlain
Opera House evening-out--
for S.B.A. -- Monday P.M & evening for
M. L. Howell --
Guest of Mr & Mrs Charles
M. Lockwood - he a nephew
of Belva's husband - splendid
people & a lovely house & home
Managers of the meeting were
Dr S.W. Duncan - &
Dr. R.H. Goodrich -
Left - P. at 5. P.M.
entries.summaryText: Journal entry from May 17, 1890, written in Brule County and Chamberlain. Susan B. Anthony attended an evening-out at the Opera House and was a guest of Mr. and Mrs. Charles M. Lockwood. She also mentions attending a meeting with Dr. S.W. Duncan and Dr. R.H. Goodrich before leaving at 5 P.M.

entries.fullText: Left Chamberlain at 8.40 - in a fearful [???] - & went with Miss S.A. Richards to her farm home in Pukwana
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony left Chamberlain and traveled with Miss S.A. Richards to her farm home in Pukwana.

entries.fullText: Drove here with Miss R. from Kimball - & rested & spoke this this ev'g in their school house
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony drove with Miss R. from Kimball to Pukwana, rested, and spoke in their school house in the evening.

entries.fullText:
Davison County W.S. Con --
Mitchell - guest of Mrs Dr.
Prescott --
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was a guest of Mrs Dr. Prescott in Mitchell, Davison County, W.S. Con was also mentioned.

entries.fullText:
Davison Co. Con.
Mitchell
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was in Davison Co. and Mitchell was mentioned.

entries.fullText:
Parkston lecture-- Hutch Co --
Mr & Mrs Culver - depot agent
spoke in new opera house
This eve
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony gave a lecture in Parkston, Hutch Co to an audience that included Mr & Mrs Culver, a depot agent, in a new opera house.

entries.fullText:
Douglas Co. Con.
Methodist Church
Armour
stopped at the P.D. Armour
Hotel
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the Douglas Co. Con. at the Methodist Church in Armour and stayed at the P.D. Armour Hotel.

entries.fullText: M.E. Church - Armour -
entries.summaryText: Attended M.E. Church in Armour.

entries.fullText: Edgerton at 11 - & Bloomington at ev'g - 9.20 [arrives] [last] big wagon load of farmers wives & children came
entries.summaryText: Visited Edgerton and Bloomington, saw a big wagon load of farmers' wives and children.

entries.fullText:
Dr. Hall [?] of old saloon or
store with only the door at one
end & [?] back of the
platform--
Miss Sara L. Ferguson
--Preceptress of the Academy
introduced me handsomely &
Mr. Miller--the M.E. [minister?]
prayed--I was? the guest
of Mrs. H.E. Reeves--who
has a nice clean house
& home-- At 10 P.M. Mrs.
Howell arrived from her
Tripp--no meeting--the
Russian trustees refused
to allow the school house
opened--The Post master
Mr. John Mcdean & Mr. R. R.
agent men her true & only American
friends there--As she left--
& came to Scotland--& Mrs.
Reeves had another bedroom
so this 26 [t?] wasn't
alone--
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was introduced by Miss Sara L. Ferguson and Mr. Miller at the Academy in Scotland. She stayed at Mrs. H.E. Reeves' house and Mrs. Howell arrived from Tripp. The Russian trustees refused to allow the school house opened.

entries.fullText:
Mr. Charles Sawton drove
us over to Olivet--went by
way of his fathers farm--only
is 12 miles instead of 8--so
we did not reach Olivet
until 12-noon--We dined
at Mr. Whites--a splendid
family of 7 children--people
had been in at 10 A.M. & driven
back home--feeling that we were
not coming.
Mr. W. R. White-Pres.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony went to Olivet with Mr. Charles Sawton and dined at Mr. Whites' house with a family of 7 children. People had been in at 10 A.M. & driven back home--feeling that they were not coming.

entries.fullText:
Drove back to Scotland
this A.M. & ____ to take
the train at 5 P.M.
Mrs. Howell for ______
____ & self for _____
But engine was broken
so didn't leave Scotland
until 9 P.M.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony drove back to Scotland and waited for a train with Mrs. Howell, but the engine was broken and they didn't leave until 9 P.M.

entries.fullText:
Bon Homme Co. Con.
Tyndall - staffed at
N__ Dakota House. Mr
Haight ___ ___ ___ enough
The Register of ...... [illegible]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a conference in Bon Homme Co. and stayed at N__ Dakota House in Tyndall. Mr. Haight was present and there was some issue with The Register.

entries.fullText:
_____ day
went from Tyndall
to _____ this day
Couldn't get into
the Merchants Hotel
so
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Tyndall to an unknown location and is unable to get a room at the Merchants Hotel.

entries.fullText:
We spoke in [?]
Hall in evening - dined
at the Ladies Hall of
the Yankton College
entries.summaryText: Spoke in [?], dined at Ladies Hall of Yankton College in the evening.

entries.fullText:
Left Yankton at 8.20 A.M.
at Centreville - a telegram
met or overtook me - from Miller
Avery - saying "Rose Avery
arrived at 11 P.M. May 31st
eight pounds - mother & daughter
doing well."
Reached Huron at 3 P.M.
found Mrs. Emma S. DeVoe
the Depot
entries.summaryText: Received a telegram from Miller Avery about Rose Avery's arrival, met Mrs. Emma S. DeVoe at the Depot in Huron.

entries.fullText: In Huron
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony wrote a brief entry on June 3, 1890, stating that she was in Huron.

entries.fullText:
In Huron
At 5 P.M. - by a
unanimous vote - I
was invited to address
the Farmers Alliance
nearly 700 delegates -
some half dozzen
women among them
entries.summaryText: On June 4, 1890, Susan B. Anthony was in Huron and was invited to address the Farmers Alliance, which consisted of nearly 700 delegates, including some women.

entries.fullText:
Clay County Convention
Vermillion--guest of
Mrs Rachel R. Austin--spoke
in Congregational Church--
a packed house
Left Huron at 7.30--
in heavy rain & wind in
north west--& drove over
to Woolsey--16 miles--for
train & reached Vermillion
at 2.30--took a short
sleep.--& made my
speech--the best I could
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends Clay County Convention in Vermillion, stays with Mrs. Rachel R. Austin, and gives a speech at the Congregational Church.

entries.fullText:
Union County Convention
Elk Point--guest
of Mr Smith--
They have been here 20 years
oldest settlers I have
found
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends Union County Convention in Elk Point and stays with Mr. Smith, who has been a resident for 20 years.

entries.fullText:
guest of Mrs -
Spoke in P.M. meeting
and took the train at
4.20 for Sioux City -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was a guest of Mrs in Elk Point and spoke in a P.M. meeting before taking the train to Sioux City.

entries.fullText:
In Sioux City
at nephew Frank
Mosher's - He went
to Unity Church in A.M.
with me - to hear the
Rev Mary A. Safford
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was in Sioux City at her nephew Frank Mosher's and attended Unity Church in the morning to hear Rev Mary A. Safford.

entries.fullText:
Stopped at Mr Bell's Hotel--
spoke in New Hall-
Had fine audience
Rev Mr. French - the
M.E. minister [?]
Mrs. Sam's in P.M.
a splendid little worker
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony stopped at Mr Bell's Hotel in Centerville and spoke at New Hall to a fine audience. She mentions Rev Mr. French, the M.E. minister, and Mrs. Sam, a splendid little worker.

entries.cityOrState: Turner County - Con Parker - Parker Hotel
entries.fullText:
Mrs. Lathrop - M.E. Church
this evening - D.P. Ward County
Pres - & his wife drove in
9 miles
Received telegram
from Pres S.A. Ramsey
They have Barkers resignation
have called state convention
Huron July 8th
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a meeting at the M.E. Church in Turner County and received a telegram from Pres S.A. Ramsey regarding Barkers resignation and the upcoming state convention in Huron on July 8th.

entries.fullText:
Parker - M.E. Church in
the P.M. and then
Baptist in the evening -
Miss S.A. Michards
called & spent two hours
entries.summaryText: Attended two church services and received a visit from Miss S.A. Michards.

entries.fullText:
- Guest of Mrs M. [?]
- with tow babies - living in
what was her kitchen &
wood or coal shed -
Had splendid audience
- but just as was half
through the lightening & thunder
scared the people & home
all went -
entries.summaryText: Stayed with Mrs M. and gave a speech to a good audience, but the event was cut short due to a thunderstorm.

entries.fullText:
Canton - Harlan Hotel -
Prof. Spofford - of Rublin Schools
left - & left things at loose
ends - but got along after
a turn -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her encounter with Prof. Spofford of Rublin Schools in Canton, Lincoln County Con.

entries.fullText: Canton - Harlan House
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her stay at Harlan House in Canton, Lincoln Co. Con.

entries.fullText:
- At Canton -
wrote letters to Carrie
Love Chapman, H. D. Bludall
Mary A. Liverman, Z.G. Wallan
Lucas M. Johns - Rev Olympia
Brown, Julia Ward Haven
Liz Stone - asking them if
they would speak at the
[?] Con. Aug 28. [a 6 ?] - and
then continue through [nice ?]
campaign
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony wrote letters to several people asking them to speak at the [?] Con. Aug 28. [a 6 ?] and continue through [nice ?] campaign.

entries.fullText:
Left Canton at 11.00
& reached Sioux Falls at
noon - Found Mr &
Mrs Lakey & Cousin
Abbie at Depot - they
took me to cousin
Edwin Anthony's
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony left Canton and arrived at Sioux Falls where she met with Mr & Mrs Lakey, Cousin Abbie, and Edwin Anthony.

entries.fullText: Sioux Falls - Germania Hall - stopped with cousin Edwin & Albie March Anthony - made my speech this ev'g
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony stayed with relatives and attended the Minnehaha County Convention in Sioux Falls where she gave a speech.

entries.fullText: Sious Falls - Germania Hall Minnehaha Co. Com. - P.M. at all souls Church - & ev'g at the Hall
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended meetings at Germania Hall and all souls Church in Sioux Falls.

entries.fullText:
Remained in Sioux Falls - Mrs H.
spoke at Dell Rapids -
- was to dine with Mrs
Eliza Tupper Wilkes -
but she didn't come for
me - & I didn't go - so
I missed - but in P.M,
Mrs Lakey took cousin
Abbie & me over to call
& then gave us a nice
drive out to the
Baptist & Lutheran
Colleges
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony remains in Sioux Falls, speaks at Dell Rapids, and visits Baptist and Lutheran Colleges.

entries.fullText:
This is for Sunday the 22nd
- at Salem - remained in
room all day - wrote 8 or 10
letters - one to Sister Annie telling
her of her brother Johns poor
wife & children
In the evening spoke in
G.A. Hall - on the former
lessons of women to
influence morals -
Miss Richard [?]
letter - that she had
seen Ransey - & he
had no new [?] [?]
until Ex. Com. had acted
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes letters and speaks at G.A. Hall in Salem on the former lessons of women to influence morals.

entries.cityOrState: McCook Point - Con - Salem - evening session
entries.fullText:
JUNE, SATURDAY 21. 1890.
McCook Point - Con -
Salem - evening session
J. D. A. spoke - stopped
at Osborne House - soon
learned it was the home
of sister Annie's brother
John P. Osborn - that he
had died March 16th leaving
a wife, a 9 years old girl & a 2 [1/2 ?]
years old boy - with eyes so
like sister Annies & so
bright like dear little Annette
- Mrs Osborn serves the house
& very nicely - it brought
back many memories of
the young kind hearted
boy in 1867 -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visited the Osborne House, the home of her sister's brother, John P. Osborn, who had passed away leaving behind a wife and two young children.

entries.fullText:
JUNE, SUNDAY 22. 1890.
McCook Co. Con -
Salem - Mrs Hamell came
from Sioux Falls when she
saw & heard Mrs [Yougan ?]
-
- a thousand - m ore or less
farmers - men, women, children
et all came into Salem &
to the County Fair grounds
for a Pic nic - Mr Goodfellow
of Madison spoke to them on
Greenbacks & National Banks -
- & I addressed them on
the largest [underlined] of all monopolies
that of man over woman
at 4 P.M. - in the evening Mrs
Hamell gave her [?] in
Grand Army Hall -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke about the monopoly of men over women at a gathering in Salem, which was attended by many farmers and Mrs. Hamell gave a speech in the Grand Army Hall in the evening.

entries.fullText:
Left Salem at 12.20 noon
Mrs. H to go to Parker & then
to Bridgewater - all by freight
train - I to Mitchell - left
Mrs. Stanton's 4th of July [vote?]
to women - Wyoming - letter
at the Republican office
to be printed - called
on Dr. Tracy - she went
with me to call on Prof
Atkinson - talked over
State Ex. Com affairs -
hard to see how things
can be gotten into working
order - then called on Mrs.
Dr. Prescott - & then came to
Lanham Hotel to tea - & am
now in a little bedroom [?]
as hot as tophet
Learn that Mrs. Nelson drove
across the country to Salem
this A.M. - that is another
of the Gen'l [?] [?] orders
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to various locations, meets with several people, and learns about Mrs. Nelson's journey to Salem.

entries.fullText:
Hanson County Con
Alexandria
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends the Hanson County Con in Alexandria.

entries.fullText:
Hanson Co. Con-
Alexandria, P. M. & ev'g
entries.summaryText: Attended a meeting with Hanson Co. in Alexandria in the afternoon and evening.

entries.fullText:
Lake County Convention
Madison - evening session
Mrs Hagar
entries.summaryText: Attended Lake County Convention in Madison during the evening session with Mrs Hagar.

entries.fullText:
Lake Co. Con.
Madison - P.M. & evening
Mrs Hagar -
entries.summaryText: Attended Lake Co. Con. in Madison during the afternoon and evening with Mrs Hagar.

entries.fullText:
Miner County Con.
Howard - P.M. & evening
entries.summaryText: Entry about Miner County Con in Howard in the afternoon and evening.

entries.fullText:
Beadle Co Con -
Huron - P.M.
J. H. DeVoe -
entries.summaryText: Entry about Beadle Co Con in Huron in the afternoon with J. H. DeVoe.

entries.fullText: [No entry for this date]
entries.summaryText: No entry for this date

entries.fullText:
Speak at Messington -
Beadle Co. at 10 A.M. -
Charles Cooper marriage -
and at Merritts Grove
at 2.30 P.M. - So. Merritt
manage - It is a Sunday
school pic-nic -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at Messington and Merritts Grove, attends Charles Cooper's marriage, and manages a Sunday school picnic.

entries.fullText: JULY, MONDAY 7. 1890.

JULY, TUESDAY 8. 1890.
Slate E. S. A. Convention
Huron-
entries.summaryText: Attended Slate E. S. A. Convention in Huron.

entries.fullText: JULY, SUNDAY 13, 1890.

people: Mary - Elizabeth M. Hammer - Mrs M. R. Sedgwick - Pastor Richard C. Walton - Mrs Jane P. Dugurd - Mrs Everhard
entries.fullText:
Highmore - S. D.
Guest of Mrs M. R. Sedgwick
Mary - Elizabeth M. Hammer - introduced me -- Congregational Church - Pastor - Richard C. Walton - will lecture - had fine audience - nearly all mothers & children - the dearth of voters in our audiences is lamentable - Mrs Jane P. Dugurd - Mother of Mrs Everhard- who had lovely horse & carriage & drove me to the depot
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Highmore, South Dakota and attends a lecture at the Congregational Church given by Pastor Richard C. Walton. She notes the lack of voters in the audience and is driven to the depot by Mrs. Everhard's mother.

entries.fullText: JULY, WEDNESDAY 23. 1890.

S. D. Press Association met in Huron - Mrs Adams of Webster & Mrs Johnson of Highmore stopped at Mrs De Voes - Mrs D. wanted to see them until 3. P. M. - & then went alone with her own horse & buggy 13 miles to Virgil -
entries.summaryText: S. D. Press Association met in Huron, Mrs Adams and Mrs Johnson visited Mrs De Voes, Mrs D. went alone to Virgil.

entries.fullText: [No entries for these dates]
entries.summaryText: No entries for these dates

entries.fullText: This day-Aug,14,1890-[stands?] out the four score years of Robert Purvis - of Phila - the noblest Roman of all of the Old Anti-Slavery men - Only Purvis & John G Whittier - line- of all who signed the Declaration of Sentiments - Dec 4th, 1833
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about Robert Purvis, a noble anti-slavery man from Philadelphia, and his connection to John G Whittier and the Declaration of Sentiments.

entries.fullText: No entry written.
entries.summaryText: No entry written.

entries.fullText: No entry written.
entries.summaryText: No entry written.

entries.fullText: Entry not found.
entries.summaryText: No entry found for August 16, 1890.

entries.fullText: Entry not found.
entries.summaryText: No entry found for August 17, 1890.

entries.fullText: AUGUST, MONDAY 18, 1890.

In Huron
the sister of Senator
Dan. Voorhees called
this afternoon - with her
daughter - her name is
Mrs Eliza Voorhees Curtis
Logan Center - School house
Canom - P.O. -
She is a bright woman
& her daughter is a
bright girl of 16 - —
entries.summaryText: Mrs Eliza Voorhees Curtis, sister of Senator Dan Voorhees, and her daughter visited in Huron. They are described as bright women.

entries.fullText:
Left Huron - at 7 A. M.
Miss Shaw in comp'ny -
reahed Mitchell at noon
- took dinner at the
Sanborn - then went to
Mrs E. T. Robinsons - where
three bedrooms were engaged
for the State Ex. Com -
Drs Troy & Halverson the
main women to mange
& Rev Adkinsn the man -
Mr Buels - failed to get
package to Depot - so
had not a program or
paper to work with -
Miss Richards, [won't?] sleep this night
on a cat bed - full of turpentine -
none of slept - Mrs Goshen then
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Huron to Mitchell with Miss Shaw and stays at Mrs. E. T. Robinson's where three bedrooms were reserved for the State Ex. Com. However, Mr. Buels failed to get the package to the Depot, so they had no program or paper to work with. Miss Richards had to sleep on a cat bed full of turpentine.

entries.fullText:
In Mitchell
not a quorum of
the Ex. Com. presnt —
- Mrs Snow, Mrs.
Johns, Mrs Chapmn
et al arrived -
entries.summaryText: Not a quorum of the Ex. Com. present in Mitchell, but Mrs. Snow, Mrs. Johns, Mrs. Chapmn, and others arrived.

entries.fullText: Rev Anna Shaw preached in M.E. Church in A.M. - A. W. Adkinson Pastor - in the Congregational Church in evening no regular pastor - and Rev Olympia Brown - [?] this prayer in [?] M. E. Chief in the A.M. and preached in the Baptist Church in the evening - while Father [Haire ?] of Aberdeen made a good W.S. speech at the Comet House in the evening -
entries.summaryText: Attended church services in Mitchell and heard various pastors and speakers.

entries.fullText: The Mitchell E. S. A. Con. for south Dakota - held in Opera House -
entries.summaryText: Attended the Mitchell E. S. A. Con. in the Opera House in Mitchell.

entries.fullText: In Huron
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony wrote a short entry stating that she was in Huron.
Susan B. Anthony wrote a short entry with no content.

entries.fullText:
[Note: entry appears at bottom of page but may be actually a continuation of a longer entry on the 6th]

_________________________________
farming - 4 years ago he
had 4,200 bushels of wheat
last year none - & this
year 800 - one fifth of a
crop
entries.summaryText: Farming notes.

entries.fullText:
Left Huron - 2.5. &
reached Iriquois - 2.55
- went Drug store - Mr
Williams - Dr Hughly
and Mrs Sheets of Edmond
called & took me to
Mrs Smith's - where I
took a good sleep
eat supper & walked
to the Opera House - &
had a 200 audience
when I should have
6 or 800 - if my speaking
had been duly advertised
in the county journal sheet -
- Slept at Judge Hammonds
- 8 grass men - 8 children -
Mrs D. Luther - oldest daughter
visits home - from very north
western county of Kansas
- a good but disorganized
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Iriquois, meets with various people, and speaks to a smaller audience than expected.

entries.fullText:
Left Iriquois at
11 A.M. - Mr Harmen
Jr - driving me with
his mother's horse
[check ?] - first to Mrs
Curtis' Sarah Voorhees
sister - then to Ezra
Fullers - 10 miles - where
I threw myself on the
bed for a half hour
then ate splendid chicken
bread, butter - & lovely home
grown raspberries & a splendid
cup of tea & glass of creamy
milk - & Mrs Fuller splendid - &
sent her [?] with me to the
McCoy School House - [?]
miles further out - where
I found a nice little number of
farmers wives & laborers
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Iriquois, Mrs Curtis' Sarah Voorhees sister, Ezra Fullers, and the McCoy School House.

entries.fullText:
In Huron
Will F. Baily - this day
drove Mr LeRoe's
horse buggy out to the
Mr [Oglehad ?] home - &
took me back home
last P.M. - - brother
[Dresser?] - then M. E.
minister was there &
introduced me -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony is in Huron and meets with Will F. Baily, Mr LeRoe, brother [Dresser?], and a M. E. minister.

entries.fullText:
Vermillion - County Fair
Mrs. H. P. Donoho-Harters
for Miss Shaw & self -
Mrs P.W. Myers - manager -
went to Letcher - instead
to fill Anna Shaw appoint
ment - Had a packed
school house - Mr & Mrs
Mayhew - thought there
were present fully 40
[?] - the rest of the
150 were women & children
Mr & Mrs [?] Jublish [?]
[?] blade - take [?]
meals at the Hotel &
work together like two
men - Mrs Brosick
to a [?] - & [?]
little girl takes meals
at the hotel !
entries.summaryText: Attended County Fair in Vermillion and went to Letcher to fill Anna Shaw appointment. Had a packed school house.

entries.fullText:
Letcher - [?] Co.
Rev. M. Albert -
Pres. of the E. S. A. -
Had a good audience
here last evening - Left
Letcher at 11.15 - and
went to Mitchell -
met Rev. A. W. Adkinson
* I left - dined at [?]
Doctors Mary & Halverson 0
- Anna Show came at 3.
and we took train at 4 -
She stopping at[SEpena ?] &
at [Mellettek ?], found no
one there so went to Scotch
- took supper & went to
bed - weather cold
enough for November -
- But slept very well
indeed -
entries.summaryText: Attended a talk by Rev. M. Albert in Letcher and then traveled to various locations with Anna Show.

entries.fullText:
on Congressmen--
in connections with
having Womens Committee
for [?] [?]
at Chicago
S [?] [?] campaigns
at 70 yrs old
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about Congressmen and the Women's Committee at Chicago, as well as S [?] [?] campaigns, at 70 years old.

entries.fullText:
Mrs Moomaw at Northville
took livery from Mellette
to Northville - 4 + miles -
& stopped at Mrs Moomaws
who drove me to Scatter
wood Lake - 12. miles -
We reached there at 12-
noon - had lunch in the
Grove - (a few willow
trees in the bed of what
used to be a lake - but
is now dry & parched like
all the other land - Spoke
at 2. to a splendid audience
men standing largely & seats filled
with women & children -
& one or two of them screached
lustily - but the mothers sat
& gazed at me meanwhile -
- but I didn't speak -
though I had had work
not to - Drove back to
N.- reaching there at 6 -
entries.summaryText: Mrs Moomaw at Northville took livery from Mellette to Northville - 4 + miles - & stopped at Mrs Moomaws who drove me to Scatter wood Lake - 12. miles - Spoke at 2. to a splendid audience men standing largely & seats filled with women & children.

entries.fullText:
at Northville
with Mr George A.
& Mrs Frances Crawford
Moomaw - a sour
cloudy day but no rain
entries.summaryText: At Northville with Mr George A. & Mrs Frances Crawford Moomaw - a sour cloudy day but no rain.

entries.fullText:
State Fair - South Dakota
Woman's Day -
Aberdeen
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the State Fair in South Dakota and Woman's Day in Aberdeen.

entries.fullText:
Left Sherdean at
9 - with Rev O. Brown
stopped at Westport -
spoke at 11 A.M -
in the M.E, Church
Mr Short & Mr Hayes
good friends &
Mr Ostrom -
the Rev [MaryAnn ?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony left Sherdean and spoke at the M.E. Church in Westport with Rev O. Brown, Mr Short, Mr Hayes, Mr Ostrom, and the Rev [MaryAnn ?].

entries.fullText:
McPherson Count. E.S. Convention
Leola - guest of
Mrs
Jeannette E. Herreid
Charles N. Herried
Rev. G. W. Hickman
- met in Cont Hall
in P.M. & in the
M.E. Church
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended the McPherson County E.S. Convention in Leola as a guest of Mrs Jeannette E. Herreid and met with Charles N. Herried and Rev. G. W. Hickman in Cont Hall and the M.E. Church.

entries.fullText: Convention - in the Skating Rink - owned by Mr. Barker - Rev. Olympia Brown & self the speakers - guests of Mrs Marcus Beher, in a lovely house & home - with two girls of 14 & 11 - & two boys of 8 & 5 - Mrs Cockran the President of the County E.S.A. - is a splendid woman - - Mrs Hickman remained & heard Mrs Brown - & then at 3.30 started for her home Leola -
entries.summaryText: Attended a convention in Ipswich and stayed at Mrs. Marcus Beher's house with other guests. Mrs. Cockran was the President of the County E.S.A.

entries.cityOrState: [ South Dakota - Womens day - State Fair - Mrs Emma Smith De Nol Sup't Women's day]
entries.fullText: Rev O.B. left Ipswich at 11.40 - for Roscoe - and I left at 6 P.M. for Aberdeen
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony and Rev O.B. left Ipswich for different destinations.

entries.fullText:
Left Aberdeen at
6. P.M. and reached
Jamestown North Dakota
at 11. Oclock at night -
& was taken to Dr
De Puy's - a lovely
home - his wife [?] died
two years ago - leaving a little
girl & boy - and Miss
Johnson is their [nanny ?]
& his housekeeper .
everything is well ordered -
Mrs Helen A [Beher ?]
on the train & stopped
off to speak at [Columbia / Columbus ?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Aberdeen to Jamestown North Dakota, stopping at Dr. De Puy's home. Mrs. Helen A [Beher ?] also stops to speak at Columbia / Columbus.

entries.fullText:
to speak this evening at the
North Dakota State W.C.T.U.
- attended the W.C.T.U.
in the A.M. & received
a hearty welcome & made
a few remarks -
Spoke in the
[rink?] in the evening to
a splendid audience of
7 or 8 hundred -
Miss Adelaide M.
Rinnear - the
Pres. of W.C.T.U.
of North Dakota
Fargo - her residence
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at the North Dakota State W.C.T.U. and attends the W.C.T.U. in the morning. She also speaks to a large audience in the evening at the [rink?]. Miss Adelaide M. Rinnear, the President of W.C.T.U. of North Dakota, is mentioned.

entries.fullText:
was present in the
Con. both A.M. & P.M.
& told the story of my [?]
in 1879 - & in the
evening listed to Mrs
Barker's charges
against the Saloon -
- & a regular manish
speech - nothing - to
show their only way
of banishing it - but is
through woman's enfran
chisement - about 4 or 5
hundred present
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends the North Dakota W.C.T.U. Con. in Jamestown and tells her story. She listens to Mrs. Barker's charges against the Saloon.

entries.fullText:
to speak at the ev'g session
- In the P.M. the
Dr. drove me out to
the Hospital for the
Insane - situated on
the west bluff of the
James River - & there
I made a talk to a few
of the inmates & many
of the W.C.T.U. women
from all parts of the state
In the evg the Birch
was litterally packed with from
10 to 12 people - & I
made the best showing
I could of the utter
inability of men alone
to enforce any of the
laws for the suppression
of the true [?] of
[?] -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at the North Dakota W.C.T.U. Con. in Jamestown and visits the Hospital for the Insane. She talks to the inmates and W.C.T.U. women. She speaks in the evening about the inability of men to enforce laws for the suppression of the true [?].

entries.fullText: Left Jamestown at 5.45 - reached Columbia at 10.20 - stopped with Mr & Mrs to dinner & took tea & slept at the Hotel - then guest of Mrs Williams - Had all the Covet House could seat - may never [str?] Mrs Barker last -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Jamestown to Columbia and stays with Mr. & Mrs. for dinner and tea. She then stays at the hotel and is a guest of Mrs. Williams. She mentions Mrs. Barker.

entries.fullText: Campbell County Con. at Mound City - Rev. O. Brown - there this day - and I speak at Bowdle Mrs J. H. Seymour " F. J. Bowman Mr Aday - Mr Davis - [Dined with] Took carriage Mrs [?] drove me from Columbia to Aberdeen - 15 miles - & got me there just as the conductor shouted all aboard - saved the train party at Bowdle at noon - was met by Miss Seymour - dined at Mrs Masons - took a sleep & then Mrs Seymour took me to Arands - to tea & sleep Raced the Congregational Church packed- good people - but such lots of babies in the front seats either playing or crying -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends the Campbell County Con. at Mound City and speaks at Bowdle. She travels from Columbia to Aberdeen by carriage and saves the train party at Bowdle. She is met by Miss Seymour and dines at Mrs. Masons before going to Arands. She attends the Congregational Church where there are many babies in the front seats.

entries.fullText:
Mound City -
A. Suntherland
James Reid
Mr & Mrs Seymour -
farmers 2 miles out of
Bowdle - drove me over
to Mound City -with a
livery team 35. miles We reached
town at 2 Oclock -
went to Hotel - Crowded
with County Fair people -
- had a good audience in
the loft of the Hotel Barn
- Miss Bowman spoke
sisterly both P.M. & evening
Mrs Emma Bowman
Mrs Sarah P. Seymour
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks in Mound City to a good audience in the loft of the Hotel Barn.

entries.fullText:
Bangor - I spoke at
the Fair Grounds at
11 A.M. and then - Mr
& Mrs Seymour, Mrs Brown
& myself drove to [Wabash]
22 miles - reached
there at 3 P.M. Mrs Brown
went over to Court House
& made the afternoon
with niece I went in
the evening & spoke to a
good audience -

We were the guest
Mrs Sally & Mrs Margaret
Axtell -
Rev M Brown -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks to a good audience in Wabash in the evening after speaking at the Fair Grounds in Bangor at 11 A.M.

entries.fullText:
all four of us drove
from Bangor to Bowdle
this A.M. - With a nice
rain coming down for
half the way - we all
four dined at Mrs
Masons - Mrs Brown
remained to speak
this evening - & to drive
over to the town to
morrow A.M. - while
I took the train at
4 p.m. & at Rosene
was met by Mr & Mrs
Lightner - & escorted to their
lovely home - had a
short sleep & an elegant
cup of coffee & made a
[two?] hours speech to a splendid
audience in the Presbyterian
church - Mrs Irwins & the
Rev Mr Gardner [?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Bangor to Bowdle and speaks at a Presbyterian church.

entries.cityOrState: Faulk County E. S. Con. Faulkton
entries.fullText:
At noon found Mrs
Brown at Depot - She
had driven across
from Bowdle - the air
cold, the wind strong -
We found Mrs [Puhler ?]
at Depot - & went with
her to Mr Bailey's - the
[?] of the [?] with F. Bailey -
to dinner - then Mrs Brown
went to P.M. meeting & I to
bed & had a good sleep - &
in the evening I spoke to a packed
M.E. Church -
At 6 - Mr Pickler
arrived from Washington -
& he made a good speech
at close of Mrs Brown's
remarks -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at a M.E. Church and is joined by Mr. Pickler from Washington.

entries.fullText: At Faulkton - Rev O. Brown & self - guests of J.A. & Alice M.D. Pickler. - O. Brown preached in the M.E. Church in A.M. & in the Congregational Church in the evening
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was a guest of J.A. & Alice M.D. Pickler in Faulkton. Rev O. Brown preached in the M.E. Church in the morning and in the Congregational Church in the evening.

entries.fullText:
Potter Point - E.S. Con.
Gettysburg
Rev. A. Metcalf - Pres.
O. Brown & self guests
of Geo R. & Mrs Pet Gibbons
Robinson - formerly of Sodus
N.Y. - the son of Rowland
Robinson -
Mrs Bryson - the Pres. of
the Relief Corps - of South Dakota -
was Miss Pratt - or Platt - who
used to teach in no. 7. & also
in Night school at Rochester
& well acquainted with Sister Mary
- we had all the seats
of the Baptist church filled in
the P.M> and Olympia made a
splendid speech & I [?] [?]
in the evening all the chairs were
brought from the M.E. church
& the house packed -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a gathering in Potter Point where she met with various people including Mrs. Bryson, the President of the Relief Corps of South Dakota, and listened to speeches given by Olympia Brown.

entries.fullText:
Forest City -
Cal. Burkley
Mother Thorne
A letter from Mrs R. M.
Springer invited me to
be her guest in Forest City -
Olympia Brown left me to
speak eastward this A.M.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony received an invitation to be a guest in Forest City from Mrs. R. M. Springer and Olympia Brown left to speak eastward.

entries.fullText: Mr Williams drove me over to Onida - 25 miles - reached there at 12.20 - & stopped with Mr & Mrs V.W. Porter - & their only daughter Mary - Had splendid audience every township represented - Mr Loucks had appointment too - so I spoke from 2. to 4 - & then the Independent's organizer their meeting & Mr Loucks spoke 2 hours - till after 6 P. M -- In evening I spoke & Mr L. sat through in the audience -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at the Sully County E. S. Convention in Onida, where she had a splendid audience and spoke for two hours.

entries.fullText: Miss Mary Porter - Mrs Augusta A. Chandler [?] teacher - and Miss Elizabeth Porter drove me from Onida to Blunt - 16 miles - stopped at hotel - Mr & Mrs Noland - found no notice of meeting here.
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Onida to Blunt with Miss Mary Porter, Mrs Augusta A. Chandler, and Miss Elizabeth Porter, but finds no notice of a meeting at the hotel.

entries.fullText:
Mrs M. Douglas 0
Laura M. Johns of [?]
with me here -
Mrs Johns did not come
- no word [?] -
spoke in P.M. before the
County Republican Convention
an hour - & in the evening
to a large audience - 200 -
in the Court House -
-- Judge Waldson -
the President introduced me
Mrs M. A. [Cowgins ?] Reed
formerly of Albia - [?]
stopping at Fall's Hotel -
engaged in town site -
selling -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spoke at the County Republican Convention and to a large audience in Fort Pierre. She was introduced by the President and was accompanied by Mrs. M. A. Reed who was selling town sites.

entries.fullText:
Remained all day
& night at Mrs Hall's
Hotel - no fire - some
in the office thick
with Tobacco smoke -
& in the kitchen- full
of cooking steams -
- so I chose the latter
& in P.M. wrote
15 letters - it rained
all the day - a
regular steady eastern
rain - Mrs. Reed -
gave me papers for a
town lot in her
addition to Fort [Perie ?]
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony spent the day and night at Mrs. Hall's Hotel in Fort Pierre. She wrote 15 letters and received papers for a town lot from Mrs. Reed.

entries.fullText:
Left Fort Pierre
at 12.30 - after
dinner - had sat
with coat on waiting
from 10. A.M. - & at noon
the rain stopped &
the wind blowed
enough to take us
off the pontoon bridge
wagon, horses & all -
- went to Mr & Mrs
Eugene Steere's - a
lovely home - Dr Steeres
wife keeping the house -
- Mr & Mrs Sterre not at
home from a two week
tour on the Indian reservation
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony left Fort Pierre and went to Mr. & Mrs. Eugene Steere's home, where Dr. Steeres' wife was keeping the house.

entries.fullText:
Hughes County Con -
Pierre - Mr & Mrs
Eugene Steeres -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was in Hughes County Con - Pierre with Mr. & Mrs. Eugene Steeres.

entries.fullText:
Hyde County Con -
Holabird -
Samuel Wright
Nettie Winans Welch
entries.summaryText: Journal entry dated October 15, 1890, mentioning a convention in Hyde County Con and Holabird, and the names of Samuel Wright and Nettie Winans Welch.

entries.fullText:
Han County Con -
Rhee Heights -
A.E. Young
entries.summaryText: Journal entry dated October 16, 1890, mentioning a convention in Han County Con and Rhee Heights, and the name of A.E. Young.

entries.fullText: OCTOBER, FRIDAY 17. 1890.
Sioux City - Iowa
[No entry for this date]
entries.summaryText: No entry written on this date

entries.fullText: Left Sioux City at 8.50 A.M - travelled all day long at Norfolk - Mrs Johnson's sister Mrs Mary Everett Peden of Boyden Iowa - with her son - the Operator - rushed into the cars & [pulled ?] us
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Sioux City to Norfolk with Mrs. Mary Everett Peden and her son, who rushed into the cars to join them.

entries.fullText:
Buffalo Gap - the Black Hills
Rev E.E. Dame
arrived at 6. A.M. - stopped
at the Grand Hotel -
far enough - had
the Congregational Church
packed - Mr Frome
presided - a Judge
Frey from Hot Springs
was at Hotel - Miss Shaw
had talk with him -
he was drunk & very
coarse & abusive
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to Buffalo Gap and the Black Hills, where she met with Rev E.E. Dame, Mr Frome, Judge Frey, and Miss Shaw. She also attended a packed Congregational Church.

entries.fullText:
Hot Springs - M.E. Church
Charles Fargo
Mr & Mrs. Eaton - (Bunker)
Rev M. Hancher -
Mr. E. Pastor - Mr Smith -
We arrived at [3 ?] P.M. -
stopped - Minakahta Hotel
- Had a packed house -
& babies ad libitum - asked
one mother to take her
screamer out - & the
Pres - Mr Eaton - com-
manded the last one to
take hers out - & at last we
were freed from crying babies
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her visit to Hot Springs, where she attended the M.E. Church and stayed at the Minakahta Hotel. She also mentions meeting with Charles Fargo, Mr & Mrs. Eaton, Rev M. Hancher, Mr. E. Pastor, and Mr Smith, and dealing with crying babies during her stay.

entries.fullText: Mrs Emma May Mrs .van Alstine Maxon - entertained us - Mr & Mrs George R. Halloley live 4 miles out of H. and were at the meeting - The freight being too late we took a Livery - Mr Edward Sweeney - and drove from Buffalo Gap to H. - 28 miles - The School House upper floor was packed & the men stood & the babies cried & cried - enough to take the last thought away from us - Mr Eaton drove us out to the Chatauqua grants - the soldiers Home & the new M.E. College of which Mr Hancher is President
entries.summaryText: Mrs Emma May Mrs .van Alstine Maxon - entertained us - Mr & Mrs George R. Halloley live 4 miles out of H. and were at the meeting - The freight being too late we took a Livery - Mr Edward Sweeney - and drove from Buffalo Gap to H. - 28 miles - The School House upper floor was packed & the men stood & the babies cried & cried - enough to take the last thought away from us - Mr Eaton drove us out to the Chatauqua grants - the soldiers Home & the new M.E. College of which Mr Hancher is President

entries.fullText: Prof. Tysee - Rev & Mrs E. Hamilton - Mrs C. C. Lisler - wife of the clothing merchant & Mrs William Christensen, wife of a groceryman called & wanted to know what they could do to [connect ?] their own husbands Mr Edward Sweeney drove Miss Shaw & me across to Hill City from Hermone 28 miles - over the hardest kind of mountain roads - It took us from 9.30 till 3. P.M., to make the trip - We stopped at Harney Peak Hotel - had the little [bath ? half ?] finished Presbyterian Church talked with the men all standing at this place we had no baby crying - Mr Hamilton presided.
entries.summaryText: Prof. Tysee - Rev & Mrs E. Hamilton - Mrs C. C. Lisler - wife of the clothing merchant & Mrs William Christensen, wife of a groceryman called & wanted to know what they could do to [connect ?] their own husbands Mr Edward Sweeney drove Miss Shaw & me across to Hill City from Hermone 28 miles - over the hardest kind of mountain roads - It took us from 9.30 till 3. P.M., to make the trip - We stopped at Harney Peak Hotel - had the little [bath ? half ?] finished Presbyterian Church talked with the men all standing at this place we had no baby crying - Mr Hamilton presided.

entries.fullText:
Custer - Court House
Rev Geo. Ulmer M.E. minister
Mr Oslo Reeder - Miss Cable
Mrs Yerkes -
entries.summaryText: Attended a meeting at Custer Court House with Rev Geo. Ulmer M.E. minister, Mr Oslo Reeder, Miss Cable, and Mrs Yerkes.

entries.fullText:
Rapid City
Geo. Menteh & Mrs [?] R.
Beach - Library Hall -
A.A. Whitfield Con [?]
wrote asking us to postpone
meeting at Rapid City - that they
couldn't have a political meeting
on Sunday - but we wrote her we
must speak there Sunday
evening or not at all -
We reached Rapid from
Buffalo Gap about noon -
took dinner & went to bed -
Miss Shaw first writing Dr W
that we couldn't see an of
the friends until 6 Oclock
Mr Lewis the President fo the
E.S.A. called - Dr's Whitfield & Mrs
& [niece ?] French - They owned
up that they had not asked
a minister of the [?] either for
his church for us to speak in
or to close his church for our
meeting - & make a union sermon -
- but we had a packed hall
- & we spoke the best we could
tired as we were - & cold as were the friends
entries.summaryText: Attended a meeting at Rapid City with Geo. Menteh, Mrs [?] R. Beach, A.A. Whitfield Con [?], Dr W, Mr Lewis, Dr's Whitfield, and Mrs [niece ?] French. Despite being asked to postpone the meeting, they spoke on Sunday evening to a packed hall.

entries.fullText:
The Pres. John Allen
C.V. Gardner - both Miss
Shaw & I stopped with the
Gardners - who have 8 children
from 21 years to six months -
- Mrs Isabella Ellerman is
the Postmaster of Piedmont -
- Left Rapid City at 7.30 A.M,
not one of the suffrage friends
came to see us off -
Found Mr Gardner at
the Depot with a cordial
greeting -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Portville - Piedmont and stays with the Gardners. She mentions Mrs Isabella Ellerman as the Postmaster of Piedmont.

entries.fullText:
F.M. Allen
Mrs Ellenn L. Williams
& [Zoll ?] - met us at Depot -
we stopped at Sheridan
Hotel - not a good thing -
well cooked -
Mrs Sparks - & Mrs Allen
both Presidents - & neither
would preside - so dear
Mrs Williams took the
entire responsibility & did all
the duties & courtesies -
She accompanied us
to Fort Mead - when
we could see the
bold mountain - 1100 feet
over house - Bear Butte
rising out of the prairie -
bold & alone -
Had a big crowd - lots
of men standing & lots
couldn't get inside -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony visits Sturgis and stays at the Sheridan Hotel. She mentions Mrs Ellenn L. Williams taking the entire responsibility of presiding duties. She also mentions the bold mountain, Bear Butte, rising out of the prairie.

entries.fullText:
- Pres - H. J. Grant we were
the guests of Mr & Mrs
James Lewis Denman - the
brother of Dr Charlotte Denman
Lozier - sister Mrs Sam'l
Burns - lives at Omaha -
- Crockery store opposite Paxton
Hotel -

Mrs Gidley - Treasurer -
- Ben. Dunham - a half
brother of Mr D. - lives
with the Denhams -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony was a guest of H. J. Grant at Mr. & Mrs. James Lewis Denman's house in Whitewood. She met several people including Dr. Charlotte Denman Lozier, Mrs. Sam'l Burns, Mrs. Gidley, and Ben. Dunham.

entries.fullText:
- J. H. Johnson
Rev J.M. Gardner
drove 18 miles from W -
took dinner at Mr Gardners -
- had afternoon meeting in his
Church - took tea with
Mr & Mrs Evans - and
slept & breakfasted Friday A.M.
with Mrs Van Horn -

Had a packed house in
the evening
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attended a meeting at Rev J.M. Gardner's church in Minnesela after having dinner with him. She also met with Mr. & Mrs. Evans and stayed with Mrs. Van Horn.

entries.fullText:
was guest J. T. Conaughy -
who 19 years ago lived in Virginia
City - Nevada & with Mrs
met me at station in
December 1871 -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony met with J. T. Conaughy who used to live in Virginia City, Nevada and who she met in December 1871 with Mrs.

entries.fullText:
Spearfish
Rev James Williams
Mrs John Cashner
Mr Morsen - Ed Queen City -
Rev & Mrs McGrady - [Cong. ?]
drove us to Centennial
there a team (Livery) with
us to Sioux City
We were the guests of
Mr & Mrs McConaughy -
Mrs Mc was born at Fort
Leavenworth - her father
was Col Rose - she with
the Stevens & others - Mrs
Hymer there - met me
at Virginia City - Nevada
in 1871 - I was guest there
of Mrs Stevens - who afterwards
married Col Farr - the
husband of Laura Farr
- Mrs Denman of Whitewood drove
over for lecture here -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Spearfish to Sioux City, stopping at Centennial, and staying with Mr. and Mrs. McConaughy. She mentions various people and geographical locations along the way.

entries.fullText:
Lead City
- Flora Washburn
Mary Green
breakfast & lunch
no good - the 2nd after
wife of the est of [?]
& no good - Mrs
R.S. [Mathers?] had us
at dinner - & drove
us to Miners Union Labor
Hall - we spoke to 200
persons - & after it - we
we went home Mrs Maroon
- who works in [?] Mill
& is German - she a
teacher hereabouts - who
had taken her homestead &
had her carriage before marriage
- Had the M.E. Church
packed in the evening - the
Rev Mr Atwater present - &
wanted me to speak at
Central -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony speaks at the Miners Union Labor Hall in Lead City and has dinner with Mrs. R.S. [Mathers?]. She also mentions various people and geographical locations.

entries.fullText:
John Burns
Mrs. J.A. Gaston - Miss [?]
Stops with Mrs G. and I with
Mrs Hattie L. Paddock - who
lived at Wilburn in the Nebraska
campaign of 1882 - & who
had a copy of Vol. 1. & had
never paid for it until - she
[yesterday?] wrote me inviting me to be
her guest & endorsed the 11.
which I at once forward
to sister Mary -

Miss Shaw & self both
speak in Labor Hall Lead City
at 2.30 - this day - she at
Deadwood - M. E. Church
this evening & I spoke at
Central - Mr Atwater -
had good audience - - stopped
at the Hotel -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her travels to Deadwood, South Dakota, and her stay with Mrs. J.A. Gaston and Mrs Hattie L. Paddock. She also mentions speaking engagements in Lead City and Central.

entries.fullText:
Opera House - ev'g
Shaw - guest of Mrs Gaston
Anthony of Mrs Paddock
guest of Dr & Mrs A. J.
Paddock - whose guest
I was at Wilber - in
the 1889 campaign in Nebraska
- Rev Atwater drove me
to Deadwood in his little
dog-cart - got here at 9.30 -
Mrs Paddock & self calling
at Mrs Gastons - & also
on Mrs Senator Moody -
her mother lives & is
95 years old -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her stay with Dr. & Mrs. A.J. Paddock in Deadwood, South Dakota, and her visit to Mrs. Senator Moody, whose mother is 95 years old.

entries.fullText: Election Day -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony wrote about Election Day in South Dakota.
Susan B. Anthony did not write anything on this day.

entries.fullText:
Kansas, E.S. A. 7th annual meeting
Ateluson - in the
Presbyterian Church - Mrs Ruth
A. Durgan Pres - I was the
guest of Mrs Emler, who
was one of the women who
set on the platform wit hme
23 years ago - when I spoke
in Atchison the night before
election in the 1867 campaign-
- & when George Francis Train
failed to reached [?] meeting
- her daughter Mrs Dorn
Emler Moon Gee - is a
bright woman
Left Leavenworth at
11 A.M- dined in the
Church & then went
into Ex.Com. meeting at
2 & 3. with public session
- audience small all
trhough - Mrs Johns read
her annual address & I closed
with a 30 minutes talk -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends the E.S. A. 7th annual meeting in Kansas, where she is a guest of Mrs Emler. She recalls speaking in Atchison during the 1867 campaign and mentions meeting with Mrs Ruth A. Durgan, Mrs Dorn Emler Moon Gee, and Mrs Johns.

entries.fullText:
In Atchison -
at Mrs Mae Gee's - three
sessions a day -
Mrs Senator Ingalls
& Mrs John [U. ?] Martin
called on me at
the church - but did not remain in
the meeting -
Mrs Chapman came
in time for evening session -
& Mrs Colby arrived at early
A.M - we three spoke
at the evening session -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends three sessions in Atchison at Mrs Mae Gee's and is visited by Mrs Senator Ingalls and Mrs John [U. ?] Martin at the church, but they do not stay for the meeting. Mrs Chapman and Mrs Colby arrive and all three speak at the evening session.

entries.fullText:
1st Atchison - at
7th Kansas Annual meeting -
at Mrs Emlers -
Judge & Mrs Webb
came to evening session
& apologized for not
calling on me earlier
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony attends a Kansas Annual meeting in Atchison and meets with Judge & Mrs Webb.

entries.fullText:
Left Atchison at 8.55
& reached Leavenworth at 10 -
- a lovely day - -
D.R. Jr. came on
the Rock Island train
from Ann Arbor - Mich -
[?]
attended M.C.J.U.
meeting in L. - some 8
or 10 women present - there
President Mrs Hastough
voted against women as
[?] delegates to the M. E.
general conference - after
ward called on Mrs
Massey - & Mrs McCormick
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels to Leavenworth and attends a meeting with the M.C.J.U. where President Mrs Hastough voted against women as delegates to the M. E. general conference. She also meets with Mrs Massey and Mrs McCormick.

entries.fullText:
In Leavenworth
A bright day -
entries.summaryText: A bright day in Leavenworth.

entries.fullText:
In Leavenworth
a bright lovely day -
after dinner Annie,
Maude & self drove out
to Cemetery - the three mounds
- covering the remains of
sister Hannah, nieces Annnette
& Susie B. all new green
with thickly mottled myrtle
- but - alas very little
of the mind & spirit of
them was there - still
one likes to go to the
place where they saw there
mortal part buried
out of their sight
strength in the home it
is where their loved spirits
still dwell - the loved
reminders of them at least
entries.summaryText: A lovely day in Leavenworth. Visited the cemetery and saw the graves of sister Hannah, nieces Annnette and Susie B. Reflects on the importance of visiting the place where loved ones are buried.

entries.fullText:
nephew D. R. went over
into Missouri hunting & brought
11 quails - After being
Charlie dress - & then
girl Jennie baked &
smothered for supper -
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony writes about her nephew going hunting in Missouri and bringing back quails, and her evening activities of dressing up and having supper.

entries.fullText:
Left Leavenworth at
7.20 - A.M. for
Fort Scott - Niece
Maude going as far
as Kansas City with me.
Found brother Merritt
at the Depot - looking
for me - though brother
D.A. had not telegraphed
as he thought he would
after my departure -
In evg went to see
masque hall - Niece Annie
rigged up as a Quaker
with plain drab dress
& white neck handkerchief
& shake Inn bonnet -
Maude & Merrit going
entries.summaryText: Susan B. Anthony travels from Leavenworth to Fort Scott with her niece Maude, meets her brother Merritt at the depot, and goes to see a masque hall in the evening with her niece Annie dressed as a Quaker.

entries.fullText: In Fort Scott
entries.summaryText: Short entry about being in Fort Scott.

entries.fullText:
In Fort Scott -
Thanksgiving Day - for
the entire nation -
Day beautiful - Merritt
drove me in old buggy down
3 miles east - to a farmer's
who had bought $215 machine
paid $5 down - & to pay $20 in
coal & balance in cash at $5.
a payment - found the
man wife & boy all picking
